snippet: The trustee appointed on behalf of investors steps into the shoes of the perpetrator of the fraud, and any knowledge of wrongdoing is attributed to the trustee, so that a claim against another participant in the scheme runs into the "in pari delicto"...
abstract: The trustee appointed on behalf of investors steps into the shoes of the perpetrator of the fraud, and any knowledge of wrongdoing is attributed to the trustee, so that a claim against another participant in the scheme runs into the "in pari delicto" doctrine.

headline.main: A Roadblock to Recovering Money for Madoff's Victims
